title: Millionaires are rethinking where they move ‚Äî soaring private healthcare costs are redrawing the global map
description: Henley & Partners say data shows wealthy families shifting plans as private healthcare costs surge worldwide and cheaper European options gain appeal.
fullText:
A surge in global wealth migration seems to be colliding with an overlooked but increasingly decisive factor: the soaring cost of private healthcare.

Henley & Partners, an investment migration firm, said its client data and new cost comparisons from a global health index show wealthy families are no longer choosing where to live solely on tax or lifestyle, but are increasingly factoring in the long-term cost of private healthcare.

The firm said in a press release this month that it has received applications from 92 nationalities in 2025, supporting clients across more than 50 residence and citizenship programs.

Applications jumped 43% year-over-year in the first three quarters of 2025 compared with the same period in 2024, it said.

"Global mobility is becoming a core risk-management strategy for wealthy families," said Christian H. Kaelin, the firm's chairman. Clients "are scrutinizing not only access to residence and citizenship, but also the real cost of sustaining that lifestyle ‚Äî especially the price of reliable private healthcare."

"Destinations that look attractive on paper can become far less so once true healthcare exposure is understood," he added.

Henley & Partners cited the SIP Health Cost Index 2025, from the SIP Medical Family Office in Switzerland, a global benchmark released earlier this month, which ranks 50 countries by the true cost of private healthcare using international private medical insurance (IPMI) premiums as of August 2025.

In Europe, the UK ($11,726) and Greece ($9,654) sit at the pricier end due in part to insurance taxes, it said. while Switzerland ranks mid-table at $8,912. The UAE ranks 10th globally, with an average of $9,680.

Some of the mid-range markets include¬†South Africa, Saudi Arabia, and Monaco, which range from roughly $7,100 to $7,600.

Kevin B√ºrchler, CEO of SIP Medical Family Office, which is behind the SIP Health Cost Index 2025, said inflation in private healthcare "is rising worldwide, but the pace and pattern differ dramatically."

Speaking to Business Insider, he pointed to "value" destinations such as Italy, Portugal, and Austria, which offer lower costs and proximity to top-tier medical hubs like Switzerland and Germany.

While ultra-high-net-worth individuals can absorb steep premiums, the cost gap matters for affluent families, especially those planning toward retirement, he said.

"It can make a significant difference whether you pay $30,000 plus for private health insurance versus $10,000," or whether "a doctor consultation costs $500 or $50," he added.

That pressure, among other factors, is reshaping behavior, especially among Americans.

"US citizens were 5% of our client base in 2018, whereas today they comprise 40%," Basil Mohr-Elzeki, managing partner at Henley & Partners North America, told Business Insider ‚Äî a shift he described as part of a broader hedge that includes healthcare resilience.

He said healthcare costs are explicitly cited in at least 15% of client decisions, making it a top-five factor behind geopolitical risk, global mobility, legacy planning, and tax optimization.

Interest is rising in Portugal, Italy, Greece, Malta, and in cost-effective Latin American options such as Panama and Costa Rica, he said, adding that Turkey also attracts clients for affordable private medical tourism.

Mohr-Elzeki said many aging clients are increasingly seeking alternative healthcare options abroad ‚Äî not only because of the cost, but also to access different medical opinions and treatments outside the US system, which he said, while "top-tier," may have a "commercial bias."

Henley & Partners said the SIP Index is helping clients "avoid hidden high-cost traps" as healthcare becomes a central part of global mobility planning.

title: In the first full year without a longtime investing leader, $55 billion Viking Global lags behind its Tiger Cub peers
description: Ning Jin, Viking Global's former chief investment officer, left at the end of August 2024 to start his own fund.
fullText:
Eleven months into 2025, $55 billion hedge fund Viking Global sits in an underwhelming position.

The long-running Tiger Cub ‚Äî a nickname for the group of firms connected to the late Julian Robertson's Tiger Management ‚Äî is up just 5.8% through November in its flagship stock-picking hedge fund after a 0.5% gain last month, a person close to the manager told Business Insider.

This trails the returns of the overall S&P 500, which was up more than 16% through the same stretch, as well as many of the firm's main rivals.

Fellow Tiger Cubs Coatue, Maverick, and D1 have all outperformed Andreas Halvorsen's Viking Global through the same stretch. Coatue is up more than 13% through November, a person familiar with the firm told Business Insider. Lee Ainslie's Maverick was up over 23% through November 21, according to HSBC's Hedge Weekly report. And Dan Sundheim's D1 has returned 28% through November in the firm's public equities book, an individual close to the manager told Business Insider.

The managers mentioned declined to comment or did not immediately respond to requests for comment.

For Viking, this run of performance coincides with the firm's first calendar year without Ning Jin, the former chief investment officer of the manager.

Jin was with Viking for 17 years and was the sole CIO of the firm in 2019 before departing in August of last year. He launched his own firm, Avantyr Capital, earlier this quarter with $1.5 billion.

Viking has become somewhat of an incubator for the industry's next generation, as several former executives for the firm have gone on to start their own funds, with Sundheim being the biggest of the Viking spin-offs.

The firm's current CIO is Justin Walsh, who first joined Viking as an intern in 2010. He started full-time at the manager in 2011 and has steadily climbed the ranks since.

At a conference last summer, Walsh spoke about the market risks associated with the growth of large multistrategy hedge funds like Citadel and Millennium, as well as his favorite luxury stock, Cartier-owner Richemont. Walsh was the portfolio manager for industrials and consumer stocks before becoming CIO after Jin's departure.

Viking's portfolio and investment style differ somewhat from those of its tech-heavy Tiger Cub peers. The manager is known for taking a more diversified approach, with a significant focus on its short book, to hedge market risk.

In 2022, that paid off for the long-running firm: Viking was down 2.5% that year in its public equities portfolio, while funds like Coatue and Tiger Global suffered much heavier losses.

But that means the firm can miss out on big gains when the market is powered by a small subset of companies. According to regulatory filings, the manager's biggest holdings, as of the end of the third quarter, are four financial services companies: PNC, JPMorgan Chase, Charles Schwab, and Capital One.

Within Viking's top 10 holdings, only Microsoft and Taiwan Semiconductor would be considered a part of the AI trade that has fueled much of the overall market's gains in 2025.

title: 'Just enjoy yourself' - When Greaves met Van Gerwen in 2016
description: In 2016, Beau Greaves emerged as a 12-year-old darts sensation. Nine years on, Greaves will line up for her second appearance at the PDC World Darts Championship.
fullText:
In 2016, Beau Greaves emerged as a 12-year-old darts sensation and met Michael van Gerwen to discuss how she got into the sport and her hopes for the future.

Nine years on, Greaves will line up for her second appearance at the PDC World Darts Championship.

Now 21, Greaves will face 22nd seed Daryl Gurney in a first-round match on Friday.

title: Kenyan debutant Munyua shocks De Decker at Worlds
description: Kenyan David Munyua causes a huge shock on his PDC World Championship debut, coming back from two sets behind to beat world number 18 Mike de Decker.
fullText:
Kenyan debutant David Munyua caused a huge shock at the PDC World Championship, coming from two sets down to beat world number 18 Mike de Decker in an enthralling end to Thursday's afternoon session.

Although Munyua had acquitted himself well on his first appearance at Alexandra Palace, an upset had looked extremely unlikely when the Belgian moved within one set of victory.

Munyua, who works as a vet, missed darts to win the second set, did the same in the third but eventually won it, edged the fourth and fought back to win the match in the fifth.

The 30-year-old, who qualified via the African Darts Group Qualifier, was broken in the first leg of the decider but produced an astounding outer bull-treble 20-bullseye 135 finish to level it, before holding his nerve to complete victory.

In his on-stage interview after the match, Munyua described his win as "amazing" and said it was a "very big moment for the sport, for Africa and for Kenya".

Former BDO world champion Mark Webster said on Sky Sports: "This is what the World Championship is all about. Forget about the stats in terms of big averages - it had drama all the way through.

"David put in a big performance. It just backs up that we're going global with this sport."

The defeat continued De Decker's disappointing record at the World Championship, with the 2024 World Grand Prix winner yet to make it past the last 64 at six appearances at Alexandra Palace.

title: How Morocco plans to use hosting Afcon as springboard to become a global football powerhouse
description: Morocco will host the Africa Cup of Nations, which begins on Sunday
fullText:
Morocco is poised to host the Africa Cup of Nations (Afcon) from Sunday, an event seen as a crucial stepping stone in its ambitious journey to become a global football powerhouse and a significant dress rehearsal for its co-hosting duties at the 2030 World Cup.

The North African nation, which famously reached the semi-finals of the 2022 World Cup, will welcome 24 teams from across the continent, utilising nine new or renovated stadiums in six cities.

This marks only the second time Morocco has staged the biennial tournament, yet it arrives amidst a period of intensified football engagement.

The country regularly hosts "home" games for other African nations during World Cup qualifiers and recently secured the rights to host five consecutive Under-17 Women‚Äôs World Cups, alongside the Women‚Äôs Africa Cup of Nations in July.

Officials openly frame this Afcon as a high-visibility dry run for the 2030 World Cup, where Morocco will serve as a primary co-host alongside Spain and Portugal, with Argentina, Uruguay, and Paraguay each hosting a single match.

A cornerstone of Morocco's grand vision is the planned Hassan II Stadium, projected to be the world's largest football arena with a capacity of 115,000 upon its completion in 2028.

This new national stadium epitomises one of Africa's most aggressive infrastructure drives.

Beyond sports, Morocco has pursued rapid development across various sectors, updating airports, expanding high-speed rail networks, and attracting major tourism investments to cities such as Marrakech and Tangier, all aimed at accommodating a surge in visitors.

The Royal Moroccan Football Federation has simultaneously invested heavily in youth development and coaching, aiming to elevate standards across the sport.

A prime example is the lavish Mohammed VI Football Complex near Rabat, which serves as the training base for the senior national team during the Africa Cup. This commitment to nurturing young talent appears to be yielding results.

Morocco's historic run to the 2022 World Cup semi-finals was a first for any African or Arab side, and the nation further cemented its rising status by winning the Under-20 World Cup in October.

Fouzi Lekjaa, president of the Royal Moroccan Football Federation, articulated this ambition to French sports paper L‚ÄôEquipe in July, stating: "It‚Äôs not dreaming, we have legitimate ambitions."

Lekjaa, who also manages budget affairs within the Moroccan prime minister's cabinet, views sport as a vital engine for economic development.

However, these significant investments have not been without controversy, sparking heated debate regarding the nation's priorities.

While thousands of visitors will encounter areas rich with hotels, restaurants, new roads, and other tourist infrastructure, vast swathes of the country present a stark contrast.

In rural regions, far removed from financial hubs, residents frequently voice complaints of neglect and a lack of investment, citing critical issues such as healthcare, literacy, and employment.

During "Gen Z" demonstrations earlier this year, protesters notably chanted, "Stadiums are here but where are the hospitals," directly linking the substantial football investments to broader societal inequalities.

Young people, in particular, express frustration over overcrowded schools, deteriorating hospitals, and inconsistent basic services.

Prime Minister Aziz Akhannouch‚Äôs government has faced accusations of channelling billions into prestige projects like stadiums instead of addressing pressing social needs.

Several members of Morocco's national team publicly supported these protests. In October, King Mohammed VI asserted that these two categories of development were not mutually exclusive or in competition.

The tournament also unfolds as Morocco actively works to solidify its position as a regional power.

Through its "Atlantic Initiative," the country has sought to deepen ties with landlocked nations in West and Central Africa, expanding the reach of its banking and telecommunications industries and offering those without coastlines access to newly constructed ports.

Morocco's normalisation of ties with Israel has strengthened its relationship with the United States, and it has also garnered support from most European Union members regarding its sovereignty over the disputed Western Sahara.

This issue, however, remains a source of tension with Algeria, despite a UN Security Council resolution this year that Morocco interpreted as a breakthrough.

The Polisario Front, based in southern Algeria, continues to advocate for the territory‚Äôs independence.

Furthermore, while Morocco has offered tourist visas to spectators attending the Africa Cup, it has simultaneously moved in recent years to curb migration from some of the participating countries.

For instance, visa requirements for Ivorian citizens were reinstated last year, partly to deter irregular migration attempts.

Morocco has long been perceived as a gateway to Europe, sharing a border with the EU via the Spanish territories of Ceuta and Melilla on the North African coast, and with Spain‚Äôs Canary Islands approximately 100 kilometres away.

The kingdom has drawn criticism from migrant rights groups for its aggressive enforcement measures, including clearing encampments and relocating migrants to remote areas far from European borders.

The Moroccan Association for Human Rights‚Äô Rabat branch reported an increase in arbitrary arrests and forced expulsions of migrants in the run-up to the Africa Cup this week.

The Africa Cup of Nations final is scheduled for 18 January at Prince Moulay Abdellah Stadium in Rabat, which opened in September.

title: Capello sees ‚Äòpositive signs‚Äô from Ferguson at Roma
description: Former Roma coach Fabio Capello sees ‚Äòpositive signs‚Äô from Evan Ferguson but is unsure the Republic of Ireland international will start against Juventus on Saturday.Roma visit Juventus in the big ...
fullText:
Former Roma coach Fabio Capello sees ‚Äòpositive signs‚Äô from Evan Ferguson but is unsure the Republic of Ireland international will start against Juventus on Saturday.

Roma visit Juventus in the big match of Serie A Round 16 on Saturday. The Giallorossi sit fourth in the table, but have only scored 16 goals, the lowest in the top 10.

ROME, ITALY ‚Äì DECEMBER 15: Evan Ferguson of AS Roma looks on during the Serie A match between AS Roma and Como 1907 at Stadio Olimpico on December 15, 2025 in Rome, Italy. (Photo by Paolo Bruno/Getty Images)

Brighton loanee Ferguson is struggling with playing time, and there are reports that he could even return to England in January, but he recently scored a brace in the Europa League against Celtic.

MADRID, SPAIN ‚Äì APRIL 20: Fabio Capello attends the Sporting Mixed Zone ahead of Laureus World Sports Awards Madrid 2025 at Palacio De Cibeles on April 20, 2025 in Madrid, Spain. (Photo by Angel Martinez/Getty Images for Laureus)

‚ÄúFerguson is starting to move better; some positive signs can be seen,‚Äù Capello told Gazzetta.

‚ÄúIt will be interesting [against Juventus] to see whether Gian Piero Gasperini will rely on Paulo Dybala‚Äôs quality or give up the Argentine to prioritise intensity, tempo and pressing.‚Äù

title: The Best Xbox Co-Op Games To Play With A Friend
description:
The best co-op Xbox games should get you yelling, cheering, and strategizing your way to a shared victory. Whether you‚Äôre sitting shoulder-to-shoulder with a friend or coordinating online across continents, there‚Äôs something uniquely enjoyable about overcoming challenges together.
Xbox‚Äôs ecosystem, bolstered by Game Pass and cross-platform support, has become a standout destination for cooperative play of all kinds. From story-driven adventures built entirely around teamwork to sprawling survival sandboxes that let players create their own world, the platform offers one of the richest selections of co-op experiences anywhere--often without the need to break the bank.
This list isn‚Äôt about the biggest names; it‚Äôs about games that foster connection.
fullText:
on December 18, 2025 at 3:29AM PST

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The best co-op Xbox games should get you yelling, cheering, and strategizing your way to a shared victory. Whether you‚Äôre sitting shoulder-to-shoulder with a friend or coordinating online across continents, there‚Äôs something uniquely enjoyable about overcoming challenges together.

Xbox‚Äôs ecosystem, bolstered by Game Pass and cross-platform support, has become a standout destination for cooperative play of all kinds. From story-driven adventures built entirely around teamwork to sprawling survival sandboxes that let players create their own world, the platform offers one of the richest selections of co-op experiences anywhere--often without the need to break the bank.

This list isn‚Äôt about the biggest names; it‚Äôs about games that foster connection. Some push innovation in engaging cooperative gameplay, others are great drop-in titles for visiting friends, and a few provide you with enough ridiculous moments to break ice of any thickness. Whatever your preferred genre or style of co-op play, you'll find something on this list that'll have you coordinating, competing, and celebrating with your pals.

Few games embody the spirit of cooperation as fully as It Takes Two. Designed from the ground up to require two players, this award-winning adventure blends platforming, puzzle-solving, and genre-hopping creativity into one of the most joyful (but also emotionally-devastating) couch co-op experiences available.

Every chapter introduces new mechanics, from magnet-powered abilities to time-manipulation sequences. These developments often echo the emotional journey of the two emotionally fraught characters, and progress demands communication, synchronization, and trust. It Takes Two's Friend‚Äôs Pass makes it even more accessible, allowing one purchase to cover both players, or to experience a demo if you've not yet taken the plunge. Whether you‚Äôre battling giant squirrels in the wild or navigating miniature worlds inside a child‚Äôs room, the adventure confronts you with themes of unity, loyalty, and the depths of familial love. It Takes Two remains one of the best co-op experiences not just on Xbox, but in gaming as a whole.

Halo has long defined cooperative shooting on Xbox, with many entries in the series still regarded as the best shooters by many, and The Master Chief Collection stands as the definitive way to experience the franchise with friends. This massive compilation includes six full campaigns, all playable cooperatively (although cross-play only works for Halo 3-4 main campaign and ODST).

Each entry offers a slightly different flavour of teamwork, from the tense corridors of the original to the squad-based vehicular chaos of later games, and offers more than 120 multiplayer maps as well as community-created co-op content.

Online co-op allows up to four players in many campaigns, while local play supports two, making it ideal for both couch and online sessions. While still a good nostalgic time, performance improvements and quality-of-life updates have polished the experience significantly since launch. Whether you‚Äôre revisiting the series or discovering it for the first time, The Master Chief Collection remains a benchmark for cooperative FPS gameplay and an essential piece of Xbox history. Why not play it on the console it was made for?

Powerwash Simulator 2 builds on the surprisingly addictive formula of the original by expanding environments, tools, and multiplayer options into a full-fledged shared experience in online, shared, and split-screen co-op. The premise is simple (you just clean things) but the game's simplicity gives way to relaxing, collaborative gameplay that'll see hours pass by as if they were minutes. Working together to restore derelict vehicles, muddied murals, and crusty old houses, turns into a calming blend of methodical cleaning and quiet teamwork. You could even use it to catch up about the day's events.

The sequel features more intricate multi-stage jobs, improved water physics, and new powerwasher customization options. Co-op lets you divide and conquer or tackle hard-to-reach angles together, and communication naturally emerges as you and your partner strategize how to approach each mess. It‚Äôs the kind of game that encourages conversation, turning long sessions into both a chill hangout and a satisfying completionist exercise. If you‚Äôre looking for low-stress, feel-good co-op where you can yap over low-stakes gameplay, Powerwash Simulator 2 is an excellent choice. Keep an eye out for new DLC, updates, and free content coming in 2026.

Chaotic, unpredictable, and consistently hilarious, Totally Reliable Delivery Service is a physics-based sandbox where the goal of delivering packages is often less central than the floppy hijinks that happen along the way.

Up to four players can join forces to race, tumble, awkwardly grapple, and ragdoll their way through a world packed with toys, vehicles, and interactive objects. The intentionally wobbly controls mean getting just about anything done is a bit of an adventure, whether you're desperately hanging onto a helicopter carrying a fragile box or launching your team into orbit with explosive machinery. Have you delivered anything in one piece? Probably not. Did you have fun doing it? Absolutely. Totally Reliable Delivery Service rarely punishes failure; in fact, failure is often the best part. It's a reliably funny pick for friend groups who are happiest when embracing the absurd.

While Formula 1 might initially seem like a solitary sport, what with being alone in the cockpit of a car for most of it, F1 25 brings in an element of competitive and cooperative racing thanks to solid online functionality and couch co-op modes.

Whether you want to compete on the same team or join a full multiplayer grid, the sense of shared progression makes the game a bit more immersive than just blasting through countless races on your own. Although we missed an F1 game in 2026, the game‚Äôs refined physics, snappy circuits, and broadcast-quality vibe make it feel every bit the modern game. It's not bad for first-time drivers, either, with accessible assists ensuring new players can keep up. F1 25 can also be played in VR, so if you're a fan of great VR games, you can literally put yourself in the driver's seat for this one.

We don't often give games 10/10 but in our Split Fiction review, we had to award this highest of accolades. This game truly is an unmissable co-op experience on Xbox. It has to be played to be believed.

Split Fiction is a two-player adventure from the creators of It Takes Two, another that made the list. Like the studio‚Äôs earlier title, every element--from puzzle design to narrative progression--requires genuine teamwork. It's not just a slapped on multiplayer mode, but a game built for two.

Protagonists Mio and Zoe are full of character and charm, traversing beautifully realized realities that shift between sci-fi structures, fantastical landscapes, and surreal dream spaces, each introducing new mechanics that emphasize collaboration, and each written or imagined by the leads themselves. It's a literary tale of friendship and creative identity, bringing together two disparate characters and their inner worlds. Whether you're manipulating time, controlling gravity, or using asymmetric abilities to bridge gaps, both players remain equally essential throughout the experience. We can't sing its praises enough.

The Hazelight Friend Pass returns, allowing two people to play with only one copy of the game, and lowering the barrier to entry. You've really got no excuse not to play one of 2025's best games on Xbox.

Grounded 2 is still in development so while you can play it on Xbox GamePass, and it's one of the best current Xbox GamePass games, it might have plenty of‚Ä¶ bugs (sorry). It's a tried and tested formula, though, by shrinking players to insect size and dropping them into a backyard teeming with danger, Grounded 2 transforms everyday blades of grass into towering forests and ants into territorial predators, expanding on the groundwork established by the original game.

Co-op is where the game's survival-crafting elements truly shine. Up to four players can work together to build bases, craft survival tools, and explore the expansive yard, discovering secrets and confronting increasingly hostile creatures. The dynamics of survival feel more approachable and enjoyable when shared, and it's a nice light-hearted alternative to usually gloomy survival games. With ongoing updates until the game leaves early access, Grounded 2 continues to expand its world, so now is the perfect time to jump in with both feet.

Vampire Survivors lets up to four players combine chaotic builds as they face endless waves of monsters in increasingly wild arenas. Cooperative play drastically alters the game‚Äôs single-stick shooter rhythm--abilities overlap, bullets multiply, and strategic synergy becomes more important as enemies flood the screen. It. Is. Chaos.

Local co-op for up to 4 players makes it easy to team up and introduce new friends to this bullet storm breakthrough. You can revive each other, share pickups, and lean into different upgrade paths to balance damage, defense, or support roles. The game‚Äôs quick sessions make it ideal for players looking to jump in for fast, intense runs without heavy time commitments. Despite its simple, retro aesthetic, Vampire Survivors delivers one of the most engaging co-op loops on Xbox thanks to its unpredictability, progression system, and endlessly satisfying power curve. Also: big walls of bullets are always fun.

Overcooked! remains one of the definitive couch co-op series thanks to its frantic kitchen chaos, escalating absurdity, and teamwork that pushes friendships to their limits. Overcooked! All You Can Eat combines both games into one delicious dish, along with plenty of new content and a full remaster.

Up to four players must coordinate to chop ingredients, cook dishes, wash plates, and serve recipes under increasingly ridiculous scenarios--just try not to lose your cool, it's surprisingly easy to do so. Communication becomes both your greatest weapon and source of silliness as plans fall apart and the group scrambles to salvage orders before the timer runs out. The addition of online multiplayer broadens accessibility, while new recipes, mechanics, and cooperative abilities enhance the game's replayability. Whether you‚Äôre cooperating to serve a dish you'd be proud of, or accidentally sabotaging each other in the heat of the moment, Overcooked! is one of the best value for money party games on Xbox where just about anyone can instantly enjoy.

Set within a sprawling, disaster-stricken research facility, Abiotic Factor blends survival, crafting, base-building, and exploration. Up to six players can work together as brilliant scientists navigating dangerous anomalies, otherworldly creatures, and the remnants of failed experiments. The game encourages players to take on complementary roles, from security teams and engineers to phytogenic botanists, each contributing unique skills to group survival.

Co-op builds naturally as you divide tasks like defending choke points, researching new tools, or expanding secure safe rooms--remember, you do have to live here too. Environmental puzzles and randomized threats keep sessions unpredictable, while its emphasis on exploration rewards groups who communicate and plan. Abiotic Factor is a co-op Xbox game that'll have you hooked right from the start with its ridiculous tongue-in-cheek humor and limitless possibilities.

A timeless sandbox classic and all-round cozy game, Terraria transforms into an entirely different experience when played cooperatively. With friends, its vast 2D world becomes a shared playground where you can collaborate on ambitious structures, share resources, and tackle bosses that benefit from coordinated combat. The Paladin's Shield accessory, for example, functions best in multiplayer, bolstering the team's defences with a buff that pulls damage onto the wearer.

The game‚Äôs progression system encourages players to split up tasks--mining for ores, exploring biomes, gathering rare items, or defending home bases, for example--while coming together for major milestones like defeating the Wall of Flesh and advancing into Hardmode. Co-op amplifies the game‚Äôs sense of discovery as players uncover secrets and generate shared stories, structures, and in-game lives. Even more than a decade after release, Terraria remains endlessly replayable thanks to frequent updates, deep crafting systems, and open-ended creativity.
